First of all Shane doesn't die- and I can say that with certainty even if I haven't seen the episode because I've kept up on interviews/press releases. Plus he's credited with being in 19 episodes (which means all of season 1 and 2.) 

I can also say that it doesn't matter if you've read the comics or not because the show doesn't follow the same storyline or even have the same characters! Example: no Daryl- he was created specifically for Norman Reedus & the show. Plus Kirkman said he wasn't going to stick to the comics & had never intended to. 

But the Shane-Rick-Lori thing is so much a part of the story that they spent so much time setting up; why would they just kill Shane in ep 9 and waste all of that? What would produce drama and tension on the show for the rest of the season?

Also- deliberately leaving spoilers is the kind of thing that will get you sent to the Special Hell; the one reserved for child molesters and people who talk in the theater.

Yes, THE Special Hell.  The one the AMC execs are going to for firing the writers and the person that brought the TV series into being, and slashing the budget to line their pockets.  

The show is becoming too contrived, trying to go back to the comic storyline since no one else is left that can drive this (better) divergent story.  But anyone that spoils it for those that do not read the comic should be banned from the internet.  There really *should* be a report button at $0.50 cost to pay for the salary of the extra staff.  I would pay to see that j-o's IP range banned.
